means: 无精打采地立、坐或行走
没精打采[垂头丧气]的姿态

sentence.Network_en: She has recently begun to slouch over her typewriter.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近，她坐在打字机前就开始变得无精打采的。

sentence.Network_en: Most of the time, they slouch around in the fields.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们绝大多数时间都无精打采地走在田间。

sentence.Network_en: He straightened himself from a slouch.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一改刚才的无精打采，挺直了腰杆。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语反义词 - 豆丁网 ... slipshod 漫不经心的>艰苦的 slouch 懒散>站直 sloven 不修边幅的>整齐的.
GRE单词33-40 - 豆丁网 ... sloth 懒惰，树懒 slouch 没精打采的样子 slough 蜕皮.
数码时代的新坐姿，你有几种？- 双语新闻 -... ... armrest 椅子扶手 slouch 懒散，无精打采 recline 躺，倚.
“红宝书”补充词汇（２） ... smithereens n. 碎片, 毁灭 slouch n. 没精打彩的样子 stampede v. (兽群)惊跑, 乱窜.

list.abs: with a slouching gait or posture ., 以没精打采的步态或者姿势.
slouching posture looks tired and uncaring ., 懒散的姿势显得疲惫和漫不经心.
slotware 槽件slouch hat 宽边软帽slouch 懒散
he is no slouch at tennis ., 他网球打得不错.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (in the sense 'lazy, slovenly person'): of unknown origin. Slouching was used to mean 'hanging down, drooping' (specifically describing a hat with a brim hanging over the face), and 'having an awkward posture' from the 17th cent

entry.tran: 无精打采地坐着(或站着)
entry.def: If someone slouches, they sit or stand with their shoulders and head bent so they look lazy and unattractive.

example.ex: Try not to slouch when you are sitting down...
example.tran: 坐的时候尽量不要无精打采的。

example.ex: She has recently begun to slouch over her typewriter.
example.tran: 最近，她坐在打字机前就开始变得无精打采的。

entry.tran: 无精打采地走;懒洋洋地走
entry.def: If someone slouches somewhere, they walk around slowly with their shoulders and head bent looking lazy or bored.

example.ex: Most of the time, they slouch around in the fields...
example.tran: 他们绝大多数时间都无精打采地走在田间。
这个小家伙愁眉苦脸，一副垂头丧气的样子。

entry.tran: 擅长;愿意卖力工作;手脚勤快麻利
entry.def: If you say that someone is no slouch at a particular activity, you mean that they are skilful at it or are willing to work hard at it.

example.ex: The Welsh are no slouches at cooking.
example.tran: 威尔士人在烹饪方面可是好手。

means.word_mean: 1. an incompetent person; usually used in negative constructions;

sentences.sentence: "he's no slouch when it comes to baseball"

means.word_mean: 2. a stooping carriage in standing and walking
1. assume a drooping posture or carriage

auth_sentence.content: Orbison was no slouch as a guitarist.
auth_sentence.res_content: Orbison was no slouch as a guitarist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Orbison was no slouch as a guitarist.

auth_sentence.content: Neanderthals did not walk with a slouch, or with bent knees.
auth_sentence.res_content: Neanderthals did not walk with a slouch, or with bent knees.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Neanderthals did not walk with a slouch, or with bent knees.

auth_sentence.content: If I do say so myself, I am no slouch at baths.
auth_sentence.res_content: If I do say so myself, I am no slouch at baths.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If I do say so myself, I am no slouch at baths.

means.word_mean: 无精打采地站(或坐、走）； 低头垂肩地站（或坐、走）

sentences.en: Several students were slouching against the wall.
sentences.cn: 有几个学生没精打采地倚在墙上。
挺起胸坐直，别歪歪斜斜的。

means.word_mean: 没精打采地站(或坐）的姿态
